inclusion.criterion: Clinical signs consistent with acute ischemic stroke
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: left upper and lower extremity weakness, dark visual spot in right eye, facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech

inclusion.criterion: No prestroke functional dependence (prestroke Modified Rankin Score ≤ 1)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: NIHSS <6 at the time of enrollment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Consent obtained within 24 hours from last known well
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Thrombolysis in Cerebral Infarction (TICI) 0-1 flow in the MCA or carotid terminus confirmed by CT or MR angiography
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: CT angiogram of head and neck reported no acute intracranial findings

inclusion.criterion: Subject can be treated within 1 hours (60 minutes) from pre-procedure CT or MRI to groin puncture
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: CT or MRI-DWI ASPECT Score of > 6 in the anterior circulation, or posterior circulation ASPECT Score (pc-ASPECTS) of > 7.36
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Female who is pregnant or lactating or has a positive pregnancy test at time of admission
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Known serious sensitivity to radiographic contrast agents
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subject with a pre-existing neurological or psychiatric disease that would confound the neurological and functional evaluations
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Computed tomography (CT) or Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) evidence of hemorrhage on presentation
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Initial CT angiogram of head and neck reported no acute intracranial findings

exclusion.criterion: Current participation in another investigation drug or device treatment study
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient presented with symptoms consistent with acute ischemic stroke, but initial CT angiogram showed no acute intracranial findings. Patient was treated with IV t-PA and high-dose statin therapy.
